docstr: `OR` — Bitwise logical OR ### Description Bitwise logical `OR`. This intrinsic routine is provided for backwards compatibility with GNU Fortran 77. For integer arguments, programmers should consider the use of the IOR intrinsic defined by the Fortran standard. ### Syntax `RESULT = OR(I, J)` ### Arguments type or a scalar `LOGICAL` type. | `J` | The type shall be the same as the type of `J`. ### Return value The return type is either a scalar `INTEGER` or a scalar `LOGICAL`. If the kind type parameters differ, then the smaller kind type is implicitly converted to larger kind, and the return has the larger kind. ### Example ``` PROGRAM test_or   LOGICAL :: T = .TRUE., F = .FALSE.   INTEGER :: a, b   DATA a / Z'F' /, b / Z'3' /   WRITE (*,*) OR(T, T), OR(T, F), OR(F, T), OR(F, F)   WRITE (*,*) OR(a, b) END PROGRAM ``` ### Standard GNU extension ### Class Function ### See also Fortran 95 elemental function: IOR
